intro: Mentha lanata, commonly known as woolly mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its fuzzy, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive texture and appearance. The plant produces small, pale blue or purple flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. Mentha lanata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often used in herbal medicine for its purported calming and digestive properties.
